channel.title: Java Dodge Ball
channel.description:
The idea of the game is to not get hit by the red balls, you are a blue ball. Your ball follows your mouse. Theres a shop where you can buy upgrades for your ball.
CONTROLS: esc - open shop mouse - move ball around To use your bullet press an arrow key then click the mouse button down to shoot. after you shoot the bullet use the arrow keys to control where the bullet goes. If the bullet goes off screen it will reset at your ball.
This game is still in development, i just thought id show off what i have added in so far. I was also hoping for suggestion on how to improve the game. And if you want to decompile my files, you can tell me how to better my code also :D [IMG]http://i162.photobucket.com/albums/t254/nodokargra/1-8.png[/img] [IMG]http://i162.photobucket.com/albums/t254/nodokargra/2-Copy.png[/img] [IMG]http://i162.photobucket.com/albums/t254/nodokargra/3-Copy.png[/img]
[url=http://uppit.com/d3nk1npx08ma/game.rar]Download[/url]

item.title: Java Dodge Ball
item.dc:creator: @sniffle6 sniffle6
item.description:
@sniffle6 wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:16, topic:376496”][quote author=sniffle6 link=topic=472420.msg3461675#msg3461675 date=1294529079]

The ball size does not reset after a new game starts/old one ends. Fix it. (Please?)

the ball size doesn’t change on the next level, the only way to do that is to buy a smaller ball size from the shop
[/quote]

He meant, when you upgrade to a smaller ball size and then u die, you keep that ball size when you restart the game. So you can have the smallest ball size on level one. If you bought it the game before.[/quote]

ooo thanks for clarifying, well i actually does that, cause of a future update i was going to do to the game, where you can chose what ball size you want to be after youv bought it. cause at some point there will be certain armors you can only wear at certain ball sizes

Read full topic

item.title: Java Dodge Ball
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

sniffle6:

[quote]The ball size does not reset after a new game starts/old one ends. Fix it. (Please?)

the ball size doesn’t change on the next level, the only way to do that is to buy a smaller ball size from the shop[/quote]

He meant, when you upgrade to a smaller ball size and then u die, you keep that ball size when you restart the game. So you can have the smallest ball size on level one. If you bought it the game before.

item.title: Java Dodge Ball
item.dc:creator: @sniffle6 sniffle6
item.description:
@sniffle6 wrote:

[quote=“recker450, post:12, topic:376496”]decompiled, editted, compiled, jarred
now hax
unlimited money
looks nice…[/quote]

hahaha hell ya
how bad does my code look?

Game seems interesting but make the background looks something different. Will play when download gets complete.

i plan on doing that eventually, probably in next version

The ball size does not reset after a new game starts/old one ends. Fix it. (Please?)
the ball size doesn't change on the next level, the only way to do that is to buy a smaller ball size from the shop
My bad, however you should get rid of the esc key being store and have the store pop up after every level with the option to "continue to level x". I can use the esc key to cheat.

hahah i use it to cheat too, i was going to eventually do that, probably will on next version

Read full topic

item.title: Java Dodge Ball
item.dc:creator: @sniffle6 sniffle6
item.description:
@sniffle6 wrote:

ollie123:

Collision detection is pretty bad, and also what David said. Apart from that, not a bad little game here :).

well those strings were just there to help me develop it, like i said this is still well in development. i just thought id show it off as it is.

and yes collision is horrid, but thanks to some fellers over at RL, i now know how to make it work perfect. Its jsut going to take alot of revising of the game.

and the score does not = the cash.

when your score hits 1600 the level restarts. You get bonus money for completing the levels.

Read full topic
